title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding in Boston area during Sunday-Monday nor'easter.
National Weather Service warns of a high-impact storm track, affecting mainly southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Significant snowfall, possible blizzard conditions expected, with power outages a concern due to heavy, wet snow.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman refuses to comment on Red Sox departure following Sam Kennedy's statement about free agency choices.
Red Sox's Sam Kennedy said Bregman could have stayed if he wanted, but Bregman valued Cubs' no-trade clause.
Bregman played a key role with Red Sox in 2025, contributing significantly both on and off the field.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' featuring Robert Duvall is available on Pluto TV and Plex after his recent passing at age 95.
'Blue Moon' by Richard Linklater, starring Ethan Hawke, streams on Netflix as a notable 2025 film.
The TV series 'The Last Thing He Told Me' starring Jennifer Garner has returned for Season 2 on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora states that Marcelo Mayer must earn a spot on the Opening Day roster this spring.
Mayer, 23, struggled offensively last year, batting .228 with four home runs and 28 RBIs in 44 games.
Mayer's health and offensive improvement during spring training could influence his role in the Red Sox's infield lineup.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Nor'easter expected Sunday night into Monday, impacting southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island with heavy snow and strong winds.
Meteorologists predict a foot or more of snow in South Shore, Cape, and possibly metro Boston.
Coastal flooding and power outages are concerns due to heavy, wet snow and strong winds.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court in-person for the first time since allegedly killing her three children in January 2023.
Clancy is facing three counts each of murder and strangulation; her trial is scheduled to start on July 20.
Clancy's defense claims she was overmedicated and had postpartum mental illness, and she plans to pursue an insanity defense.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved a home rule petition for a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million.
The fee aims to raise up to $60 million annually for housing initiatives, pending approval by the state legislature.
The proposed fee ranges from 0.5% to 4% on sales above $1 million, with possible exemptions for first-time buyers and retirees.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police announced a scheduled 'Northshore Mall takeover' event for Friday at 3 p.m., emphasizing public safety.
Authorities coordinated with local and state agencies, preparing to respond if safety concerns arise during the mall event.
Previous similar events involved vehicle stunts, leading to violence and property damage; legislation proposed to confiscate implicated vehicles.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Eight defendants charged after authorities seized 25 firearms and large amounts of drugs across Eastern Massachusetts.
Harvard Street Gang investigation led to arrests, targeting Brockton, Randolph areas for drug distribution activities.
Defendants, including Lue Andrade, face charges for firearm possession and intent to distribute controlled substances.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics to join the Warriors, citing reasons beyond just basketball and a desire for a fresh start.
The Celtics aimed to lower salary expenses, influencing Horford's decision in a period when he sought new opportunities.
Coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford, calling him a Hall-of-Famer and valuing their relationship despite Horford's departure.
